Comment: This common, monotonous, mundane, nullifying almost reprehensible move lacked the innovation i desired for an entertaining game... oh well
i countered it with the favourite of the cowards and minds of those where the kindling of a brain had never begun in the first place- i sort of just insulted myself
he was not hampered by my decision and adhered to enhancing his control over the center of the board
unique in the sense it isn't played often but cowering in the depths and allowing the cold war style tension to bring is my cup of tea.
shame... it appears he has plans for my pieces- a fate which isn't ideal in my opinion
enforcing my defense and playing along with my own creation of a pawn jig.
oh no- now i had to make the deadly decision of allowing him to draw blood first or be taken array with this extremely tempting bait...
couldn't resist- not really my style but through this game i do develop a ruthless personality in an urge for greater power and control!
rough- atleast it saVED me the burden of dutifully caRING for that measley pawn and i did expect that to happen
bring on my own strikem whilst simultaneously advancing my superiority in this game
retreat- cowering among his own barracks
a nice pin to disable that threatening peice- but it is probably only going to be a temporary thing
this person appears to have a penchant of being attacking and generally a nuisance
that allows me to retain the pin, unless white is foolishly willing to play g4, weakening his right hand side of the board
there he goes, taking advantage of my undeveloped side and thus trundling on in his own fight for control in the board
im not to be left behind

uh? looking at it briefly it appears to do little to my impermeable defence structure though i must grudgingly accept allows his queen and rook to connect, which can engender further threat in the approaching, daunting future of this so thrilling a game!
an attempt to get a placid castling done to put my king away in the realms of safety

this opponent is really pestering and tenacious. Atleast the advancing foolishly of these pawns reduces any chance of his king castling on this side- unless he is feeling extremely ambitious and optimistic!
not much choice there for me
